lexUnit.name: edge.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to go along the edge of; move carefully

sentence.text: In the year to December , pre-tax profits edged ahead from £40.3 million to £42.7 million .
Earnings per share edged ahead from 10 p to 10.2 p , and the shares gained 11 p to 245 p .
Earnings per share only edged up to 4.82 p , from 4.77 p , but a final dividend of 3.4 p ( 3.3 p ) lifts the total from 4.8 p to 4.9 p .

There was better news from Marley 's plumbing , plastic moulding and flooring businesses , where operating profits edged ahead from £27.3 million to £28.8 million , while automotive components more than doubled to £2.8 million .
Over the same period Japanese wholesale prices rose by 1.0% and Swiss prices edged down 0.1% .
As chart 14 shows , the annual default rate on junk bonds edged up in 1989 to 4% and in 1990 doubled to 8.7% .
Interest rates have edged down , and more banks are switching to variable interest rates pegged to their prime lending rate .
Wall Street edged up 0.9% and the world index gained 1.2% .
Profits edged up £59,000 to £2.12m before tax .
Retailing profits edged up from £205 million to £214 million , within which the Comet electrical chain performed ` especially well " and only the B & Q DIY business reported a fall .
Output of oil , gas and coal fell fractionally , however , and the index of all industrial production edged down from 106.5 to 106.4 .
The shares edged ahead 4 p to 484 p .
Peugeot 's annual turnover , however , edged ahead from £1.4 billion to £1.5 billion .
In the year to December , pre-tax profits edged ahead from £40.3 million to £42.7 million .
Within a short time of opening , the FTSE had edged ahead 3.3 p to 2828.9 .
Profits edged ahead to £12.5m and further expansion of its shops and product licensing is underway .
Newcastle edged ahead again in the 31st minute when defender Kevin Scott hooked home from close range .
Frogmore Estates edged ahead 2 p to 463 p , British Land went 3 p better to 383 p while MEPC advanced 8 p to 495 p .
The government 's opinion-poll rating has edged up , from 20.1% in November to 26.3% in May , according to polls conducted by Yomiuri Shimbun , Japan 's biggest newspaper .
Canada 's broad-money growth edged down to 7.2% in the year to April .
America 's 12-month consumer-price inflation edged up to 5.3% in February .
Japan 's wholesale prices edged up by just 0.1% in the year to April , and Swiss producer prices fell 0.1% .
Britain 's jobless rate edged down to 5.6% in February , but the fall was the smallest since the present decline began in 1986 .
The share of Eastern Europe and the former Soviet Union has edged up from 9% to 11% .
Her expenditure on food for the month had edged up to £5 !
Wages edged up to an average of £19.58 , and the bank rate came down to 6 per cent , but mortgages went up from 6 to 6 & 1/4% .
